meanings.definition: To look fixedly or vacantly at someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She stares at the stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: He often stares at his computer screen while working.
meanings.sent3: The cat stares at the empty food bowl, hoping for a refill.
meanings.sent4: The painting on the wall stares back at those who pass by.
meanings.sent5: His intense stare makes others feel uncomfortable.

meanings.sent1: The stares of the audience made her nervous during the speech.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't help but notice the curious stares of his classmates.
meanings.sent3: The dog's stare at the treat on the table was comical.
meanings.sent4: The stare of the old tree in the forest seemed to hold ancient wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The intense stare of the statue gave it a lifelike quality.
